alert.note: Alert for Cottle; Dickens; King; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 4:35AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Dickens, King, southwestern Childress, Motley, Cottle and southeastern Hall Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 434 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Flomot to 7 miles southwest of Guthrie. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Childress, Paducah, Matador, Guthrie, Cee Vee, Swearingen, Flomot, Grow, Dumont, Tell, Northfield, Finney, Delwin, Chalk, Hackberry and Estelline. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
